Not sej or ryze who hang out around a 45% winrate in plat+ and yet still received another nerf :).

The nerfs that they're getting, while unnecessary, won't really affect solo queue at all. Sej isn't meant to do damage, so her E proc reduction is kinda irrelevant aside from early clear, and Ryze E-W root is mostly used in pro play for gank assist. I'm not saying they were needed, but they're also not really that bad
cutting 1/4th of a champions CC won't be relevant to soloQ btw :^)

Its literally .5 seconds off a 2 second root. That's basically where the root landed if someone bought Mercy Treads. Not that big of a deal, especially since E-W is basically only used for pick potential, while most people use W-E-Q for movespeed/shield.

The downsides of a large player base. There's people of every opinion, but no one posts on the boards for "hey, I think velkoz is pretty alright right now. Thanks riot!". This is pretty much my exact opinion (he's well balanced, has his place in the game, and doesn't feel too shoved out by meta picks, even if play rate is low). 

For any given topic tho, you'll only get posts by people who are unhappy with the system, as they have a reason to post. It's one reason the boards echo chamber so well, and why you have to take the anger with a grain of salt.

I also do okay with poke champs (Ziggs, Velkoz), some tanky guys (Singed, Urgot for example - Nunu might be okay for me - Jury is out on him/them still) and some supports (Janna and.. uh, Janna?), but I veer away from assassins and mages with complex combos, because I suck with those (KISS-principle applies to me and my champions.) I am a simple guy, so I like the champions I can play relatively well, and dislike the ones I suck with. Oh, and I guess I am a bad boards person, since I don't think I whine about champions or balance that much.
